ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.summary: Super Learner Equation Modeling Package SLEM / DAGLearner takes in some data, a DAG (as a networkx graph), and a dictionary of variable types, and implements Super Learners for every variable with parents in that DAG. This enables one to perform effect-size estimation without the usual constraints on functional form associated with (linear) path models / structural equation models.

Super Learner Equation Modeling Package SLEM / DAGLearner takes in some data, a DAG (as a networkx graph), and a dictionary of variable types, and implements Super Learners for every variable with parents in that DAG. This enables one to perform effect-size estimation without the usual constraints on functional form associated with (linear) path models / structural equation models.

name: slem-learn
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "slem-learn" %}
{% set version = "0.0.14" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/slem-learn-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 36cfe00b0812da161e1522a3b14110a7d9a22a39df2cb7ab142afa0ab2152e70

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - setuptools >=42.0
    - wheel
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - numpy >=1.20.0
    - scikit-learn
    - scipy
    - networkx
    - pandas
    - tqdm
    - matplotlib-base

test:
  imports:
    - slem
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/matthewvowels1/SLEM
  summary: Super Learner Equation Modeling Package
    SLEM / DAGLearner takes in some data, a DAG (as a networkx graph),
    and a dictionary of variable types, and implements Super Learners for every
    variable with parents in that DAG.
    This enables one to perform effect-size estimation without the usual 
    constraints on functional form associated with (linear) path models / 
    structural equation models.
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - dillonroach
